docs.snippet: The Holland-America liner Nieuw Amsterdam arrived last night from Rotterdam with 1,934 passengers. It was the largest number ever carried on the ship and included the greatest number of American refugees that had left Europe since the war began....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Holland-America liner Nieuw Amsterdam arrived last night from Rotterdam with 1,934 passengers. It was the largest number ever carried on the ship and included the greatest number of American refugees that had left Europe since the war began. There were 647 first, 494 second, and 793 third class passengers, to accommodate whom the ship was taxed to her utmost.
docs.abstract: Nieuw Amsterdam arrives in N. Y. with refugees, statement of Capt. Barron

headline.main: 3,600 REFUGEES HOME ON 2 SHIPS; The Nieuw Amsterdam Arrives Here After Meeting with British Cruiser Essex.

docs.snippet: Speculation has been rife among automobile men in this country as to the ultimate effect of the European war on the automobile trade of this country, especially on its export side. A highly optimistic view of the opportunity now offered American...
docs.lead_paragraph: Speculation has been rife among automobile men in this country as to the ultimate effect of the European war on the automobile trade of this country, especially on its export side. A highly optimistic view of the opportunity now offered American manufacturers is expressed by Horseless Age in its current issue. It says, in part:

headline.main: BIG OPPORTUNITY FOR AUTO EXPORT; War Will Open South American Field to Our Makers, Says Horseless Age. BALANCE IN OUR FAVOR While 1913 Auto Exports to Europe Were $7,000,000 Foreign Exports Were $13,000,000.

docs.snippet: SCHENECTADY, Aug. 26. -- Samuel Gompers, President of the American Federation of Labor, this afternoon addressed the convention of the New York State Federation. He praised the workmen's compensation law, and said if prosperity followed the European...
docs.lead_paragraph: SCHENECTADY, Aug. 26. -- Samuel Gompers, President of the American Federation of Labor, this afternoon addressed the convention of the New York State Federation. He praised the workmen's compensation law, and said if prosperity followed the European war it must be shared by empolyers with their employes.
docs.abstract: Pleiades of Luckenbach Steamship Co. goes through from San Francisco to N. Y.

headline.main: LAUDS COMPENSATION ACT.; Gompers Fears Attacks on It Threaten Industrial Peace.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26. -- Criticising the Government departments for slowness in putting into operation the emergency legislation which Congress passed at the outbreak of the European war. Representative James R. Mann, the Republican House leader,...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 26. -- Criticising the Government departments for slowness in putting into operation the emergency legislation which Congress passed at the outbreak of the European war. Representative James R. Mann, the Republican House leader, today read a telegram received by him from James A. Farrell, President of the United States Steel Corporation, pleading for an immediate proclamation by the President making effective the ship registry law, passed more than a week ago.
docs.abstract: protests against delay in operation of ship registry bill, telegram from Pres. Farrell read in the House

headline.main: SHIP PROCLAMATION URGED BY FARRELL; Head of Steel Corporation Wants President to Act Quickly on Registry Bill. VESSELS AWAIT TRANSFER But Nothing Can Be Done Until Terms Are Known ;- War Risk Bill May Be Sent to President Tonight.

docs.snippet: The plan for the proposed City Department of Commerce was outlined yesterday by Joseph Hartigan, Commissioner of Weights and Measures, and secretary of the Mayor's Committee on Food Supply. Tomorrow Mr. Hartigan will present this plan to Mayor...
docs.lead_paragraph: The plan for the proposed City Department of Commerce was outlined yesterday by Joseph Hartigan, Commissioner of Weights and Measures, and secretary of the Mayor's Committee on Food Supply. Tomorrow Mr. Hartigan will present this plan to Mayor Mitchel and ask that provision for it be made in the proposed charter revision.
docs.abstract: Hartigan to present plan to Mayor

headline.main: COMMERCE BUREAU FOR CITY FAVORED; Commissioner Hartigan to Present to Mayor Plan for a New Department. FOR CHECK ON LEGISLATION "Get Together" Agency to Deal with Producers, Shippers, and Transportation Companies.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15. -- Treaties were signed simultaneously today at the State Department by the diplomatic representatives of Great Britain, France, Spain, and China and by Secretary Bryan, representing the United States, providing for a commission...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 15. -- Treaties were signed simultaneously today at the State Department by the diplomatic representatives of Great Britain, France, Spain, and China and by Secretary Bryan, representing the United States, providing for a commission of inquiry to pass upon international disputes which may arise between these countries and the United States.

headline.main: BRYAN SIGNS FOUR NEW PEACE TREATIES; More Than 4 Billion People Now Are Protected Against War. BRITAIN ACCEPTS THE PLAN With France, Spain, and China, Signs Conventions ;- Bryan Invites Germany, Austria, and Russia.

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

headline.main: DR. DEVINE MAKES NEUTRALITY PLEA; School of Philanthropy Head Warns N. Y. U. Students Not to Take Sides in War. MUST WAIT FOR FULL FACTS Preservation of Peace Between America and Warring Nations Now Our Most Important Task.

docs.snippet: In the long periods of trade dullness and slow recuperation that follow upon the world's wars the talk of bankers and financial writers about repairing the wastes of war has a doleful sound in the ears of the great and small captains of industry. The...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the long periods of trade dullness and slow recuperation that follow upon the world's wars the talk of bankers and financial writers about repairing the wastes of war has a doleful sound in the ears of the great and small captains of industry. The worst of it is that what the bankers and financial writers say is true.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: E U R O P E A N WAR

docs.snippet: A continuance of unseasonably warm weather during the past week has been no aid to general business, particularly in the lines of apparel. Still, there are directions in which wholesome activity has been shown and many others which hold forth good...
docs.lead_paragraph: A continuance of unseasonably warm weather during the past week has been no aid to general business, particularly in the lines of apparel. Still, there are directions in which wholesome activity has been shown and many others which hold forth good promise of fulfilment when the temperature comes to a reasonable understanding with the calendar.

headline.main: THE MERCHANT'S POINT OF VIEW; Some Figures of the Raw Materials of Manufacture Like Wool and Leather.
